page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY LACON HALL
page.content: Lacon Hall was probably built at the same time as Fountains Abbey in 1132. Recently when they were turning it into holiday flats they found timber framing,an inglenook fireplace and solid oak beams.The beams are so hard, it is almost impossible to drive a nail into them.Evidence shows that it was thatched many years ago.Fifty years ago it was a farm.There were 14 or 15 milk cows,60 sheep and 2 large cart hores.A pack horse track from Fountains Abbey leads through the yard and on to Nidderdale.After they got rid of the shire horses,the family said they could still hear them kicking against the wall in the stable at night.
